title: 1. Installation
text: stable version package available CRAN servers, means can install regular install.packages() function. reason, installlation CRAN fails, might need look alternative methods.

title: 1. Installation
text: sake completeness simplicity, sources stable version also deposited Zenodo. install.packages() function can used install source (although might install dependencies package. )

title: 1. Installation
text: encounter technical problems package described anywhere, might want take look development version GitHub. wish install development version, recommend manual installation: 1. Clone repository local hard drive. 2. Rename r_client directory chronosphere. 3. Open terminal navigate directory cloned. chronosphere visible . 4. Run line terminal see error suggesting R found, add PATH environmental variable. R packages chronosphere depend installed, install manually, get error.

title: 2. Available data
text: make Available database - variable combinations can inspected datasets() funciton:
code: library(chronosphere) #> Chronosphere - Evolving Earth System Variables #> Important: never fetch data as a superuser / with admin. privileges! #>  #> Note that the package was split for efficient maintenance and development: #>  - Plate tectonic calculations -> package 'rgplates' #>  - Arrays of raster and vector spatials -> package 'via' dats <- datasets() #> Use datasets(dat = <dat>) to see available versions and resolutions. str(dats) #> 'data.frame':    20 obs. of  9 variables: #>  $ topic          : chr  NA NA "Paleogeography" "Paleogeography" ... #>  $ databaseName   : chr  "Code, used data and supplementary items for the articled Increase in marine provinciality over the last 250 mil"| __truncated__ "Repository for: Reddin et al. 2020. title: 3. Fetching data items
code: library(chronosphere) #> Chronosphere - Evolving Earth System Variables #> Important: never fetch data as a superuser / with admin. privileges! #>  #> Note that the package was split for efficient maintenance and development: #>  - Plate tectonic calculations -> package 'rgplates' #>  - Arrays of raster and vector spatials -> package 'via'

title: Internals
text: Functions reused packages (necessary cases). part base R distribution.

title: Internals
text: utils::read.csv(): Used read registry tables. utils::download.file(): Used downloading default sockets. utils::unzip(): Used extracting zip archives fetching. utils::flush.console(): Used console-feedback. utils::sessionInfo(): Used get chronosphere version display appropriate logs. utils::assignInNamespace(): Used replace variables package namespace, instance configure() fetching. utils::broweURL(): Used access information data items info().

title: Internals
text: tools::md5sum(): Used check integrity downloaded files.

title: Internals
text: Functions packages used functions (optional): tinytest: Used execute minimalstic testing CRAN, complete tests locally. curl: alternative downloading default R sockets, CURL can used main engine, can set configure().

title: Evolving Earth System Data
text: implemented functions allow query, download, import remotely-stored version-controlled data items. inherent meta-database maps data files import code programming classes allows access items via files deposited public repositories. purpose project increase reproducibility establish version tracking results (paleo)environmental/ecological research.

title: Evolving Earth System Data
code: library(chronosphere)  # see available datasets available <- datasets()  # download some data # NaturalEarth land polygons ne <- chronosphere::fetch("NaturalEarth", var="land", ver="4.1.0")  # The entire Paleobiology Database pbdb <- chronosphere::fetch("pbdb", ver="20230621")  # collections colls <- unique(pbdb[, c("collection_no","lng", "lat")])  # plot records plot(ne$geometry, col="gray", border=NA) points(colls$lng, colls$lat, cex=0.3, pch=16, col="#54121212")

title: Evolving Earth System Data
text: original chronosphere true monolith included lots additional functionality manipulate paleoenvironmental data. better compliance UNIX philosophy efficient distribution/development, original package broken three R packages: chronosphere: version-controlled data distribution. rgplates: functions related tectonic reconstructions. via: Virtual Arrays efficient organisation high-dimensional data. beta version, like R, comes absolutely warranty.

title: Evolving Earth System Variables — chronosphere
text: implemented functions allow query, download, import remotely-stored version-controlled data items. inherent meta-database maps data files import code programming classes allows access items via files deposited public repositories. purpose project increase reproducibility establish version tracking results (paleo)environmental/ecological research. still Release Candidate version. R, free software comes ABSOLUTELY WARRANTY. Nevertheless, notes found bugs suggestions welcome. chronosphere links data code deposited public servers, can inspected using code data URLs items (codeURL, primaryURL secondaryURL result datasets(master=TRUE)). using package agree take responsibility items download. Never run fetch() superuser administrative privileges! can open security hole exploited case remote servers get hijacked.

title: Evolving Earth System Variables — chronosphere

title: Function to configure the behavior of the chronosphere package. — configure
text: timeout Timeout option used default R download socket. global default value 500, can increased large files slow internet connection. effect, curl=TRUE. remote Character string URL chronos server. curl Logical value 'curl' package variable.

title: Function to configure the behavior of the chronosphere package. — configure
text: function return value.

title: Function to configure the behavior of the chronosphere package. — configure
text: following package-wide variables can set. timeout: Positive integer. Timeout connections seconds default R sockets used. global setting default `300`.  #' remote: Character string. URL chronosphere repositories, default value "https://github.com/chronosphere-portal/chrono_arch/raw/main/". curl: Logical value. set TRUE (default), curl libraries used download files. set FALSE (default) default R sockets used, can result timeout issues need resolved manually.

title: Function to configure the behavior of the chronosphere package. — configure

title: Download a database extract from chronosphere remote server — datasets
code: datasets(   dat = NULL,   datadir = NULL,   verbose = FALSE,   master = FALSE,   greetings = TRUE,   all = FALSE )

title: Download a database extract from chronosphere remote server — datasets
text: dat character. Database ID. set NULL, simplified list availables variables downloaded, including dat var combinations. dat valid database ID, accessible resolutions version dataset shown. datadir character Directory downloaded files kept. Individual entries looked directory given, downloaded found. default NULL option download data temporary directory exists R session ends. verbose logical console feedback download displayed? master logical dat NULL, function download master records file? greetings logical function invoked without arguments, displays message keep new users informed different versions resolutions (even verbose=FALSE). argument turns message demand. logical set FALSE (default), items shown available R environment. Set TRUE see items.

title: Download a database extract from chronosphere remote server — datasets
text: data.frame class object.

title: Download a database extract from chronosphere remote server — datasets
text: function download single .csv file attach data.frame.

title: Download a database extract from chronosphere remote server — datasets
code: # available datasets and variables - proper # index <- datasets() # all available versions and resolutions in database 'pbdb' # oneDat <- datasets("pbdb") ################################### # local example INCOMPLETE - does not connect to the internet ind <- datasets(   datadir=system.file("extdata", package="chronosphere")) #> Use datasets(dat = <dat>) to see available versions and resolutions. # one available archive ind <- datasets(   dat="SOM-zaffos-fragmentation",   datadir=system.file("extdata", package="chronosphere"))

title: Data fetching — fetch
text: Function download attach variables chronosphere package

title: Data fetching — fetch
code: fetch(   dat = NULL,   var = NULL,   ver = NULL,   res = NULL,   ext = NULL,   class = NULL,   item = NULL,   datadir = NULL,   verbose = TRUE,   call = FALSE,   call.expr = FALSE,   attach = TRUE,   ... )

title: Data fetching — fetch
text: dat (character) dataset get variables . var (character) Vector variable names get. ver (character) version variable. Defaults NULL, download latest available version. create data table, part package. searched valid argument combinations. Right just folder date. res (character numeric) resolution raster layers. RasterLayers make variable. ext (character) File extension used data file. class (character) Class returned object, default. item (numeric) item ID downloaded. setting overrides identifiers. datadir (character) Directory downloaded files kept. Individual layers looked directory given, downloaded found. default NULL option download data temporary directory exists R session ends. verbose (logical) console feedback download displayed? call (logical) set TRUE function call returned instead object. call.expr (logical) call set TRUE, call returned expression (TRUE) message (FALSE)? attach (logical) item required packages, attached? ... Arguments passed variable-specific loading functions.

title: Data fetching — fetch
text: object class matches 'class' coordinate item.

title: Data fetching — fetch
text: Use function datasets find available variables.

title: Data fetching — fetch
code: # An actual download call # a <- fetch(dat="paleomap", var="dem") # A locally-present object, in package's directory a <- fetch(dat="SOM-zaffos-fragmentation",   datadir=system.file("extdata", package="chronosphere")) #>  #> ------------------------------------------------------------ #> Accessing chronos registry tables. #> ------------------------------------------------------------ #> Found downloaded registry tables. #>  #> ------------------------------------------------------------ #> Item no. 23, dat:SOM-zaffos-fragmentation, var: fragment, ver: 20170424, res: 1my. #> ------------------------------------------------------------ #>  #> ------------------------------------------------------------ #> Loading downloaded import code. #> ------------------------------------------------------------ #>  #> ------------------------------------------------------------ #> Loading downloaded data file. #> ------------------------------------------------------------ #>  #> If you use the data in publications, please cite its #> reference(s), as well as that of the 'chronosphere' project. #> Zaffos, A., Finnegan, S., & Peters, S. E. (2017). Plate tectonic regulation of global marine animal diversity. Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences, 114(22), Article 22. https://doi.org/10.1073/pnas.1702297114 # call repetition fetch(a, call=TRUE) #> fetch(dat="SOM-zaffos-fragmentation", var="fragment", ver="20170424", res="1my", verbose=FALSE)

title: chronosphere 0.4.0 (build 77) - 2020-10-13
text: package collate DESCRIPTION SpatialArray class added package, mimicking RasterArrays vector objects. SpatialList class added, used SpatialStack. XArray class-union made efficient generalization methods shared RasterArray SpatialArray. Shared methods impplemented. spTransform() function implemented SpatialStacks SpatialArrays. apply() function gained MARGIN=NULL submethod. submethod useful iteration functions every XArray item. mapedge() function quick calculation map edges non-equirectangular projections. ‘coasts’ data demo object PaleoMAP Paleocoastlines types() generic SpatialArray-method added.

title: chronosphere 0.4.0 (build 77) - 2020-10-13
text: Multiple RasterArray methods now generalized XArray longer specific RasterArrays. vignette renamed chronos.Rmd chronosphere.Rmd, references ‘clim’ removed uses ‘coasts’ now instead

Setting master argument ‘master=TRUE’ download list archives, expected long near future. argument ‘greetings=TRUE’ display reminder additional versions resolutions available. downloaded objects now chronosphere attributes. record accession information used previously, allows repetition function call, necessary - including changes. fetch() can return function call, using call=TRUE. can either expression terminal message, depending settings call.expr=TRUE/FALSE. fetch() can used already downloaded chronosphere-object either redownload , get download function call. fetch() can used return multiple variables dataset. concatenated list, unless RasterArrays, case fetch() try cbind() extent() method RasterArray class server log log.csv checked per session.
